member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Components.ExecutionContext.TaskExecutionContext.InitialiteServerSpecifics
member.summary: This method is supposed to initialize server-related information even for local execution, provided that server is connected

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Components.ExecutionContext.TaskExecutionContext.InputFilesContainsAlias(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the collection of input files contains an element with the specified alias.
member.param:
The alias whose existence is tested.
Aliases are case insensitive (comparer: 'OrdinalIgnoreCase').
If aliasValue is null, empty or if it consists only of white space chars, the method interprets the call as a request to resolve the primary input file.
member.returns: True, if the collection of input files contains an element with the specified alias; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Components.ExecutionContext.TaskExecutionContext.InputFileByAlias(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the name of input file with the specified alias.
member.param:
The alias whose corresponding input file name is requested.
Aliases are case insensitive (comparer: 'OrdinalIgnoreCase').
If aliasValue is null, empty or if it consists only of white space chars, the method interprets the call as a request to resolve the primary input file.
An exception is thrown if an input file with the specified alias does not exist.
member.returns: The name input file with the specified alias.
member.exception: If aliasValue is not found.

member.summary: Gets the service object with the specified id.
member.param: A string containing the id of the service to get.
member.returns: If found, a reference to the service with the specified id; otherwise, null.
member.exception: If serviceId is null.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Components.ExecutionContext.TaskExecutionContext.ServiceIdToType(System.String)
member.summary: Maps a service id to the service type.
member.param: A string containing the id of the service to map.
member.returns: If found, the Type object of the service with the specified id; otherwise, null.
member.remarks: This implementation uses - if available - the service IServiceTypeResolver to lookup the type of the service. If IServiceTypeResolver is not available in ServiceProvider, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Components.ExecutionContext.TaskExecutionContext.GetService(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the service object of the specified type.
member.param: An object that specifies the type of service object to get.
member.returns: A service object of type serviceType.-or- null if there is no service object of type serviceType.
member.exception: If serviceType is null.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Components.ExecutionContext.TaskExecutionContext.UserCulture
member.summary: Gets / sets a refernce to the current user's locale.
member.returns: A CultureInfo reference to the current user's locale or null.
member.remarks:
The default value is null.
For a server-side context, this property should be set to the current user's locale of the IDEA client.
This property is used by the CalendarTableCreator.

This is an IDEA 9 requirement. However, the function does not check if the object implements these interfaces.
Flag specifying server-side or client-side execution

member.summary: Retrives the index of audit folder specified by its name.

The parameter names are case insensitive (comparer: 'OrdinalIgnoreCase').

member.returns: Index of audit folder, if the list of folder metadata objects contains an audit folder with the specified name; otherwise, -1.
member.exception: If auditFolderName is null.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ICirExecutionContext.IsServerImportTask
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the IDEA databases are located on the server.
member.remarks: This property does not have always the same value as the property IsServerTask. Certain subtasks of a CIR do not run on IDEA Server (e.g., dialog tasks) and therefore IsServerTask will always be false for them. This property tells the caller whether the IDEA databases that were imported by the running CIR are located on the server or not.

member.name: T:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.IMessagesCollector
member.summary: The interface IMessagesCollector collects messages that are to be displayed in the message window.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.IMessagesCollector.Name
member.summary: Gets / sets the name of the collection of messages.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.IMessagesCollector.MessageGroups
member.summary: Gets an enumerator for the list of message groups.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.IMessagesCollector.Add(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a message to a new anonymous group at the end of the list or to a group with the specified name, or changes the title of a specified group.
member.param: The message to be added. The message is ignored if it is null or empty.
An optional group title. The group title is ignored if it is null or empty.

An optional message group name. If the group name is null or empty or if it consists only of white-space characters, a new anonymous message group is added at the end of the list, but only if the title or the message are not null or empty. If the group name is not null or empty or if it does not consist only of white-space chars and if the title and the message are not both null or empty, then the function adds a new message group with the specified name at the end of the list, if one with the given name does not already exist (the function uses the OrdinalIgnoreCase comparer). The function adds the message, if not null or empty, at the end of the list of messages of the target group (i.e., the newly added group or the one with the specified name) and sets the title of the target group, if the specified title is not null or empty.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.IMessagesCollector.Clear
member.summary: Removes all groups and messages from the collector.

member.name: T:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.IMoveImportedFilesToFolderTask
member.summary: The interface IMoveImportedFilesToFolderTask provides access to the properties and methods of task that moves imported files to another folder.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.IMoveImportedFilesToFolderTask.Add(Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ISimpleImportFile2,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a move operation to the task.
member.param: An ISimpleImportFile2 reference to the imported database to be moved. An exception is thrown if this reference is null. An exception is thrown if the import file does not support moving to another folder (that is, import.SupportsMovingDatabaseToFolder is false).

The name of the destination folder relative to the current project. The destination must be a subfolder of the current project. If the source and destination are the same, the move operation does nothing. If a database with the same name already exists in the destination folder, the operation tries to move the database to the specified folder using a new name. The method does not overwrite databases in the destination folder.
An exception is thrown if this name is null or if it is not a relative path. An exception is thrown if the destination folder does not exist.
member.exception: If importFile is null.
If the specified import file does not support moving the database.
If folder is null.
If the path to the folder is absolute.
If the destination folder does not exist.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.IMoveImportedFilesToFolderTask.PerformTask
member.summary: Executes the task and resynchronizes the names of the imported databases.
member.exception: If the current execution context does not support moving the database.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.IPartialImportContext3.RegisterDatabase(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a database with the CIR's collection of imported databases.
member.param:
A string containing the name of the database to register. Leading and trailing spaces are ignored.
An exception is thrown if this name is null or empty, or if the database does not exist.

A string containing the alias under the which the database will be registered with the CIR's collection of imported databases or null. If null or empty, the application will generate an unique alias.
An exception is thrown if the CIR's ImportFiles (note: the collection of imported databases) already contains an element with the same alias (note: the comparison is case insensitive). However, an exception exists: If the registration is performed by a CIR extension and the proposed alias was inherited from the main routine. In this case, the entry that was inherited from the main routine will be replaced with the entry registered by the extension.
member.returns: A ISimpleImportFile2 reference to the object in ImportFiles that holds information about the database.
member.exception: If databaseName is null.
If databaseName is empty or if databaseAlias is not null or empty and an element with the same alias already exists in the routine's ImportFiles collection.
If the database does not exist.
member.remarks: The registration may change the reference to the collection of imported databases. If the registration succeeded, the caller should requery the context object for the new ImportFiles collection.

member.name: T:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.IRegisterDatabaseService
member.summary: IRegisterDatabaseService provides an interface to a service that registers databases with a CIR's collection of imported databases.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.IRegisterDatabaseService.RegisterDatabase(Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ICirExecutionContext,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a database with the CIR's collection of imported databases.
member.param:
An ICirExecutionContext reference to the CIR execution context in which the registration request occurred.
An exception is thrown if this reference is null.

A string containing the name of the database to register. Leading and trailing spaces are ignored.
An exception is thrown if this name is null or empty, or if the database does not exist.

A string containing the alias under the which the database will be registered with the CIR's collection of imported databases or null. If null or empty, the application will generate an unique alias.
An exception is thrown if the CIR's ImportFiles (note: the collection of imported databases) already contains an element with the same alias (note: the comparison is case insensitive). However, an exception exists: If the registration is performed by a CIR extension and the proposed alias was inherited from the main routine. In this case, the entry that was inherited from the main routine will be replaced with the entry registered by the extension.
member.returns: A RegisterDatabaseResponse that contains a reference to the new ImportFiles collection and an ISimpleImportFile2 reference to the element of the new ImportFiles collection that represents the specified database.
member.exception: If sender or databaseName is null.
If databaseName is empty or if databaseAlias is not null or empty and an element with the same alias already exists in the routine's ImportFiles collection.
If the database does not exist.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ISimpleImportFile2.SupportsMovingDatabaseToFolder
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the current execution context allows moving the database to another folder.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ISimpleImportFile2.MoveDatabaseToFolder(Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ICirExecutionContext,System.String)
member.summary: Moves the database to the specified folder of the current project.
member.param:
A ICirExecutionContext reference to the current execution context. An exception is thrown if this reference is null.
An exception is thrown if the current execution context does not support moving the database, that is if SupportsMovingDatabaseToFolder is false.
Currently only IPartialImportContext supports this operation.

The name of the destination folder relative to the current project. The destination must be a subfolder of the current project. If the source and destination are the same, the method does nothing. If a database with the same name already exists in the destination folder, the method tries to move the database to the specified folder using a new name. The method does not overwrite databases in the destination folder.
An exception is thrown if this name is null or if it is not a relative path. An exception is thrown if the destination folder does not exist.
member.exception: If context is null.
If folder is null.
If the path to the folder is absolute.
If the current execution context does not support moving the database.
If the destination project subfolder already contained a database with the same name and the method could not move the database after retrying the operation a predefined number of times.
If the ImportedFileName is not null or empty and the file does not exist.
If the destination folder does not exist.
member.remarks: If the current object's ImportedFileName is null or empty, the method does nothing. If the database is moved, the method updates ImportedFileName to reflect the changes.

member.name: T:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ISimpleImportFiles
member.summary: The interface ISimpleImportFiles provides access to a collection of ISimpleImportFile objects.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ISimpleImportFiles.Item(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the object with the specified Alias or at the specified zero-based index.
member.param: A value that specifies which object to return. If Index is a string, the function retrieves the item whose Alias is equivalent to Index. If Index is an Int32, the function retrieves the item at the specified index. If Index is neither a string, nor an Int32, an InvalidCastException exception is thrown.
member.returns: Returns the item with the specified Alias or ar the specified index. If the item is not found, an exception is thrown.
member.exception: If Index is null.
If Index is a string and the collection does not have an item with an equivalent Alias.
If Index is an Int32 and it is less than 0 or Index is equal to or greater than Count.
If Index is neither a string, nor an Int32.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ISimpleImportFiles.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements in the collection.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ISimpleImportFiles.Contains(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the collection contains an element with the specified alias.
member.param:
The alias whose existence is tested.
Aliases are case insensitive (comparer: 'OrdinalIgnoreCase').
An exception is thrown if the alias is null.
member.returns: True, if the collection contains an element with the specified alias; otherwise, false.
member.exception: If alias is null.

member.summary: Gets / sets a value that specifies if the task requires that the caller expands the environment variables in the command line before executing the task.

member.summary: Gets / sets the name of the executable. This value depends on the ImplementationType. If ImplementationType is Com, Name contains the ProgId of the corresponding component. If ImplementationType is Exe, Name contains the file name of the image. If ImplementationType is DotNetAssembly, Name contains specifies the class / method that must be called. If the ImplementaionType is one of the IDEA macro types, the Name is not bound to a disk file.

member.summary: Implements custom publishing of shared data. The Collaborator calls this method as the very first during the publishing process. If the method returns SharedActionState.Processed, Collaborator takes publishing as completed If the method returns SharedActionState.NoCustomProcessing, Collaborator goes ahead with standard publishing workflow If the method returns SharedActionState.NotSupported, Collaborator skips this action object completely and continues with the next action available
member.param: User Id to publish new results for
preliminary shared result info
if true, action was performed on local data
If the action wants publishing to make user's last sync date get updated, sync date is returned here

member.summary: Gets / sets the week numbering to be used.

member.summary: Gets / sets a Boolean that specifies whether the first row of the calendar table is the zero-period row corresponding to IDEA's zero-date.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.ICalendarTableCreator.WeekendsMask
member.summary: Gets / sets a bit pattern specifying the weekends (bit 0: Sunday, bit 1: Monday, ... bit 6: Saturday). This property is ignored unless WeekendsOption is set to ExcludeCustomWeekends.
member.remarks: Default value: 0.

member.name: T:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IColumnFilterBuilder
member.summary: Defines an interface to a task that creates an IDEA column filter expression.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IColumnFilterBuilder.Database
member.summary: Gets / sets the name of the IDEA database or a reference to an IDEA database object on which the filter expression operates.
member.remarks:
This property is optional. It is only needed in case the normal filter expression exceeds the maximum allowed length.
The default value is null.
The database can either take the database file name with or without extension and path or a reference to an IDEA database object as returned by Client.OpenDatabase.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IColumnFilterBuilder.Equation
member.summary: Gets a string containing the filter expression.
member.returns: A string containing the filter expression or null, if an expression was not generated.
member.remarks: Default value is null.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IColumnFilterBuilder.ColumnName
member.summary: Gets / sets the name of the column whose values will be filtered.
member.remarks: Default value is null.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IColumnFilterBuilder.TempColumnNames
member.summary: Gets the array of temporary helper column names that were added to the source database in case the normal filter expression exceeded the maximum allowed length.
member.returns:
the array of temporary helper column names that were added to the source database in case the normal filter expression exceeded the maximum allowed length.
An empty array is returned if the filter expression was not computed or if it did not exceed the maximum allowed length.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IColumnFilterBuilder.Values
member.summary: Gets / sets a reference to the object that supplies the list of column values (usually a dialog's list element, e.g, a ContentOfFromToList or ContentOfSingleList or an object that impl. IContentOfSingleListReader or IContentOfFromToListReader) for the equation.
member.returns: An object that contains the list of values or null, if no values where specified.
member.remarks: The default value is null.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IColumnFilterBuilder.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Gets / sets a Boolean that specifies whether the equation has to consider case sensitivity.
member.returns: True, if the comparisons inside the equation shall be case insensitive; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The default value is False.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IColumnFilterBuilder.GetMatchingRecords
member.summary: Gets / sets a boolean that specifies whether the equation shall select all the records whose ColumnName value belongs to the given set of values or all the records that are not part of the given value set.
member.returns: True, if the equation shall select all records that belong to the specified value list; false, if the equation shall select all records that do not belong to the specified value list.
member.remarks: Default value: True

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IColumnFilterBuilder.PerformTask
member.summary: Performs the task by building the equation or the requested file.
member.returns:
An Int32 value. One of the following values will be returned:
1, if the length of the equation is less than the maximum allowed length.
The length of the equation in case the equation exceeds the maximum allowed length and Database was not set or an equivalent equation could not be generated.
0 in case temporary helper columns were added to the database. The names of the helper columns are available in the array TempColumnNames and the filter expression based on these columns in Equation.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IColumnFilterBuilder.Clear
member.summary: Resets the object to its default state.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IColumnFilterBuilder.ReservedLength
member.summary: Gets / sets a non-negative integer that represents the reserved equation length.
member.remarks: This property can be used to limit the maximum length of the equation to the difference between IDEA's max. equation length and the specified amount.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IMacroDialogTaskResult.Outputs

member.summary: Defines an interface to a task that checks the wellformedness of EU VAT registration numbers.

member.summary: Gets / sets a string containing the value to be checked.
member.remarks: The default value is null.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IVatRegNoChecker.CountryCode
member.summary: Gets the language-independent country code of Value.
member.returns: A string containing the language-independent country code of Value or null, if the country code is not available.
member.remarks: The default value is null. Call the method Perform before getting the actual value of the property.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IVatRegNoChecker.Country
member.summary: Gets the language-dependent country name of Value.
member.returns: A string containing the language-dependent country name of Value or null, if the country name is not available.
member.remarks: The default value is null. Call the method Perform before getting the actual value of the property.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IVatRegNoChecker.StructureValidity
member.summary: Gets a boolean that specifies whether the structure of Value is valid.
member.returns: True, if Value's structure is valid; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The default value is false. Call the method Perform before getting the actual value of the property.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IVatRegNoChecker.RuleValidity
member.summary: Gets a VatConstructionRulesValidationResult value that specifies whether Value fulfills the VAT construction rules of its country.
member.returns: RulesFulfilled, if Value fulfills all construction rules, RulesNotFulfilled, if Value does not fulfill the construction rules or RulesNotAvailable, if the construction rules of Value's country are not available.
member.remarks: The default value is RulesNotFulfilled. Call the method Perform before getting the actual value of the property.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IVatRegNoChecker.PerformTask
member.summary: Executes the task and stores the results in CountryCode, Country, StructureValidity and RuleValidity.
member.remarks: The method resets CountryCode, Country, StructureValidity and RuleValidity to their default state before performing the check.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IScriptCommands.NewSpecialDayFilter(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructs a new special day filter from the specified data or data provider object.
member.param:
An object that specifies the data or data provider object for the filter object.
Accepted types:
1) IContentOfListReader with the list element of type Date.
2) IEnumerable<DateTime>.
3) IEnumerable for a collection of boxed DateTime values.
4) IEnumerable for a collection whose elements are of type a) DateTime, b) object array of min length two, having at index 0 the IDEA string rep. (format yyyyMMdd) of a valid Gregorian calendar date and at index 1 the name of the special day, c) String containing the IDEA string rep. of a valid Gregorian calendar date or d) SpecialDayData.
5) IEnumerable<SpecialDayData>.
member.returns: An ISpecialDayFilter reference to the filter object.
member.exception: If values is null.
If values is of an unsupported type or if it contains items of an unknown format or nulls.
member.remarks: If values is an empty collection of a supported type, the method returns an empty filter.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.MacroCommands.IScriptCommands.NewAnonymousSpecialDayFilter(Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Parameters.IContentOfListReader)
member.summary: Constructs a new anonymous special day (e.g., day off) filter from the specified list of date or date range values.
member.param: An IContentOfListReader reference to a list of date or date range values.
member.returns: An ISpecialDayFilter reference to the filter object.
member.exception: If values is null.
If values's element type is not Date.

The string names are case insensitive (comparer: 'OrdinalIgnoreCase').

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Services.IProjectEnvironment.GetValidUsers(System.Boolean,System.String@)
member.summary: Returns the list of possible users with their location (Local, Server or Default (Local and Server)) and their backup timestamp (only for current user)
member.param: if set to true the list of possible users is restricted to last user that performed take ownership (if its data is available)
returns the last user that transferred ownership if allUsers is false and last user is not current user and last user data still exists on disk

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Services.IProjectEnvironment.TransferOwnership(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.Exception@)
member.summary: Renames one user data to another user
member.param: The original user name; cannot be null or empty
The new user name; if null or empty, current user will be assumed
Timestamp of the data backup (will be ignored if null or empty)
Returns path of the library back up
Returns any error found
member.returns: Null in case process cannot be performed because the parameters are not correct or at least one of the needed files are in use or backup file could not be created False in case the process failed (in this case exception and backupZip parameters are filled) True in case the process succedeed (in this case the backupZip parameter is filled)
member.remarks: If oldUser equals newUser, but timestamp is not set, the parameters are not considered correct

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Services.IProjectEnvironment.RollbackSALibraryBackup(System.String)
member.summary: Performs a rollback of SA library folder from the given zip backup.
member.param: Backup file
member.returns: Null if there process worked fine, or error if the process failed.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.IExecutionContext.InputFilesContainsAlias(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the collection of input files contains an element with the specified alias.
member.param:
The alias whose existence is tested.
Aliases are case insensitive (comparer: 'OrdinalIgnoreCase').
If aliasValue is null, empty or if it consists only of white space chars, the method interprets the call as a request to resolve the primary input file.
member.returns: True, if the collection of input files contains an element with the specified alias; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.IExecutionContext.InputFileByAlias(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the name of input file with the specified alias.
member.param:
The alias whose corresponding input file name is requested.
Aliases are case insensitive (comparer: 'OrdinalIgnoreCase').
If aliasValue is null, empty or if it consists only of white space chars, the method interprets the call as a request to resolve the primary input file.
An exception is thrown if an input file with the specified alias does not exist.
member.returns: The name input file with the specified alias.
member.exception: If aliasValue is not found.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Trees.IUniqueIdentifierTree.GetFirstLevelSubdirectoriesOf(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns all first-level subdirectories of the specified directory in the increasing order of their position.
member.param: The id of the node whose subdirectories to retrieve. By using the special value 0, the caller can retrieve the root directory.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Trees.IUniqueIdentifierTree.InsertDirectory(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts the specified directory into the tree. The function generates a unique id for the new node.
member.param: The name of the new directory. An exception is thrown if this reference is null. The name must not be unqiue inside the parent directory.

The zero-based position of the node in the list of subdirectories of the specified node. The special value -1 can be used in case the node will be added to the end of the list. If position equals the number of sibling subdirectories, the node will also be added to the end of the list. Otherwise the position must be an interger between 0 and the number of sibling subdirectories minus 1.
The id of the parent node.
member.returns: The identifier of the new database entry.
member.exception: If the object is read-only.
If position is neither -1, nor a valid index in the list of existing sibling subdirectories.
If name is null.
If parentId does not identify an existing node.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Trees.IUniqueIdentifierTree.MoveDirectoryTo(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves a directory to another location.
member.param: The identifier of the directory to move. An exception is thrown if the directory does not exist.

The identifier of the directory to which the function moves the source directory. An exception is thrown if the destination does not exist. An exception is thrown if the destination is a subdirectory of the source directory or if source and destination are the same.

The zero-based position of the node in the list of subdirectories of the specified node. The special value -1 can be used in case the node will be added to the end of the list. If position equals the number of sibling subdirectories, the node will also be added to the end of the list. Otherwise the position must be an interger between 0 and the number of sibling subdirectories minus 1.
member.exception: If the object is read-only.
If source and destination are the same, or if the destination is a descendant of the source.
If sourceId does not identify an existing directory.
If destinationId does not identify an existing directory.
If position is neither -1, nor a valid index in the list of existing sibling subdirectories.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Trees.IUniqueIdentifierTree.RecursivelyDeleteDirectory(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the specified node (if not a root) and all its descendants.
member.param: The id of the node to delete. The function does nothing if the specified directory does not exist.
member.remarks: If the specified node is a root (that is, its Parent id is 0), only its descendants will be deleted.
member.exception: If the object is read-only.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Trees.IUniqueIdentifierTree.RenameDirectory(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Renames the directory with the specified id.
member.param: The id of the directory to rename. An exception is thrown if the directory does not exist.
The new name of the directory. An exception is thrown if this reference is null.
member.exception: If newName is null.
If the object is read-only.
If the specified directory does not exist.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Trees.IUniqueIdentifierTree.ImportDirectoryFrom(System.Int32,Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Trees.IUniqueIdentifierTree,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Imports a directory and all its descendants to the specified directory.
member.param: The identifier of the directory to import. An exception is thrown if the directory does not exist.
The FunWithFavs source object that contains the directory to import. An exception is thrown if this reference is null. FunWithFavs can be equal to the current instance.

The identifier of the directory to which the function copies the source directory. An exception is thrown if the destination does not exist. If the source object is the same as the current instance, then an exception is thrown if the destination is a subdirectory of the source directory or if source and destination are the same. If the source object and the current instance are different but are using the same database and the destination is a subdirectory of the source directory or if source and destination are the same, then the behavior of the function is not defined.
If the destination directory contains a subdirectory with the same name as the source, the function will not merge them. A directory with the same name will be added to the destination.

The zero-based position of the node in the list of subdirectories of the specified node. The special value -1 can be used in case the node will be added to the end of the list. If position equals the number of sibling subdirectories, the node will also be added to the end of the list. Otherwise the position must be an interger between 0 and the number of sibling subdirectories minus 1.
member.returns: The identifier of the copy of the source directory.
member.exception: If source is null.
If sourceId does not identify an existing directory.
If destinationId does not identify an existing directory.
If source and destination are the same, or if the destination is a descendant of the source.
If position is neither -1, nor a valid index in the list of existing sibling subdirectories.
If the object is read-only.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Trees.IUniqueIdentifierTree.InsertLeaf(System.Guid,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts the specified leaf reference into the tree. The function generates a unique id for the new entry.
member.param: The identifier of the leaf to insert.
The id of the parent node.
member.returns: Returns a pair whose boolean part returns true if the leaf was inserted and false if the parent already contained a leaf with the same identifier, and whose int part returns the identifier of the new entry or the identifier of the existing entry.
member.exception: If parentId does not identify an existing node.
If the object is read-only.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Trees.IUniqueIdentifierTree.DeleteLeaf(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the specified leaf.
member.param: The id of the leaf to delete. The function does nothing if the specified leaf does not exist.
member.exception: If the object is disposed.
If the object is read-only.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Trees.IUniqueIdentifierTree.InsertLeaves(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Guid},System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a sequence of leaves into the specified directory. The function generates unique ids for the new entries.
member.param: The reference identifiers to insert. An exception is thrown if this reference is null.
The id of the parent node.
member.returns: A list of pairs, in the order in which the referenceIds were enumerated. Each entry corresponds to the referenceId on the same position and is a pair whose boolean part returns true if the leaf was inserted and false if the parent already contained a leaf with the same identifier, and whose int part returns the identifier of the new entry or the identifier of the existing entry. The function returns an empty list if the input sequence is empty.
member.exception: If referenceIds is null.
If the input sequence is not empty and the parentId does not identify an existing node.
If the object is read-only.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Trees.IUniqueIdentifierTree.DeleteLeaves(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Deletes the specified leaves.
member.param: The ids of the leaves to delete. The function does not fail if the sequence is empty or if the sequence contains leaves that do no exist. An exception is thrown if this reference is null.
member.exception: If ids is null.
If the object is disposed.
If the object is read-only.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Trees.IUniqueIdentifierTree.DeleteLeavesByRefId(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Guid},System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes all the specified leaves of the given directory.
member.param: The ids of the leaves to delete. The function does not fail if the sequence is empty or if the sequence contains leaves that do no exist. An exception is thrown if this reference is null.
The id of the directory whose leaves to delete. The function does nothing if the directory does not exist.
member.exception: If ids is null.
If the object is disposed.
If the object is read-only.
member.remarks: Only the direct descendants of the directory will be removed.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Trees.IUniqueIdentifierTree.MoveLeavesTo(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves a set of leaves to the specified directory.
member.param: The identifiers of the leaves to move. An exception is thrown if this reference is null or if it contains a leaf that does not exist. If the sequence is empty, the function does nothing.
The identifier of the directory to which the function moves the source directory. An exception is thrown if the destination does not exist.
member.returns:
A list of pairs, in the order in which the leaves were enumerated. Each entry corresponds to the leaf on the same position and is a pair whose boolean part returns true if the leaf was inserted and false if the parent already contained a leaf with the same identifier, and whose int part returns the identifier of the leaf or the identifier of the existing entry.
The function removes all input leaves from their parent directory (if the destination is different than the source directory).
The function returns an empty list if the input sequence is empty.
member.exception: If leaves is null.
If the object is read-only.
If destinationId does not identify an existing directory.
If sequence contains an item that does not exist.
member.remarks: The behavior is 'all or nothing'.

member.name: T:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder
member.summary: Implements a task that creates an IDEA column filter expression.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new ColumnFilterBuilder in the default state.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.Database
member.summary: Gets / sets the name of the IDEA database or a reference to an IDEA database object on which the filter expression operates.
member.remarks:
This property is optional. It is only needed in case the normal filter expression exceeds the maximum allowed length.
The default value is null.
The database can either take the database file name with or without extension and path or a reference to an IDEA database object as returned by Client.OpenDatabase.

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.m_databaseValue
member.summary: Holds the value of the Database property that was set by the caller or null.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.Equation
member.summary: Gets a string containing the filter expression.
member.returns: A string containing the filter expression or null, if an expression was not generated.
member.remarks: Default value is null.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.TempColumnNames
member.summary: Gets the array of temporary helper column names that were added to the source database in case the normal filter expression exceeded the maximum allowed length.
member.returns:
the array of temporary helper column names that were added to the source database in case the normal filter expression exceeded the maximum allowed length.
An empty array is returned if the filter expression was not computed or if it did not exceed the maximum allowed length.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.ColumnName
member.summary: Gets / sets the name of the column whose values will be filtered.
member.remarks: Default value is null.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.Values
member.summary: Gets / sets a reference to the object that supplies the list of column values (usually a dialog's list element, e.g, a ContentOfFromToList or ContentOfSingleList or an object that impl. IContentOfSingleListReader or IContentOfFromToListReader) for the equation.
member.returns: An object that contains the list of values or null, if no values where specified.
member.remarks: The default value is null.

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.m_values
member.summary: Holds the value of the Values property that was set by the caller or null.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Gets / sets a Boolean that specifies whether the equation has to consider case sensitivity.
member.returns: True, if the comparisons inside the equation shall be case insensitive; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The default value is False.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.GetMatchingRecords
member.summary: Gets / sets a boolean that specifies whether the equation shall select all the records whose ColumnName value belongs to the given set of values or all the records that are not part of the given value set.
member.returns: True, if the equation shall select all records that belong to the specified value list; false, if the equation shall select all records that do not belong to the specified value list.
member.remarks: Default value: True

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.ReservedLength
member.summary: Gets / sets a non-negative integer that represents the reserved equation length.
member.remarks: This property can be used to limit the maximum length of the equation to the difference between IDEA's max. equation length and the specified amount.

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.m_reservedLength
member.summary: Holds the value of ReservedLength

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.PerformTask
member.summary: Performs the task by building the equation or the requested file.
member.returns:
An Int32 value. One of the following values will be returned:
1, if the length of the equation is less than the maximum allowed length.
The length of the equation in case the equation exceeds the maximum allowed length and Database was not set or an equivalent equation could not be generated.
0 in case temporary helper columns were added to the database. The names of the helper columns are available in the array TempColumnNames and the filter expression based on these columns in Equation.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.Clear
member.summary: Resets the object to its default state.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.SetDefaultState
member.summary: Sets the object in the default state.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.ResetOutputState
member.summary: Resets the values of the output properties.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.HandleEmptyValueList
member.summary: Handles the case of an empty list of column values.
member.returns:
An Int32 value. One of the following values will be returned:
1, if the length of the equation does not exceed the max. allowed length. The method sets Equation to the all-rows filter, if GetMatchingRecords is true, or to the no-row filter, if GetMatchingRecords is false.
The length of the equation, if it exceeds the max. allowed length.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.HandleDateList(Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Parameters.IContentOfSingleListReader)
member.summary: Handles the case of a list of date values.
member.param: An IContentOfSingleListReader reference to the list of values. An exception is thrown if this reference is null or if its type is not Date.
member.returns:
An Int32 value. One of the following values will be returned:
1, if the length of the equation is less than the maximum allowed length. If the list is empty, the method sets Equation to the all-rows filter, if GetMatchingRecords is true, or to the no-row filter, if GetMatchingRecords is false.
The length of the equation in case the equation exceeds the maximum allowed length and Database was not set or an equivalent equation could not be generated.
0 in case temporary helper columns were added to the database. The names of the helper columns are available in the array TempColumnNames and the filter expression based on these columns in Equation.
member.exception: If listReader is null.
If listReader.IsDate is false.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.HandleLongDateList(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.DateTime},System.String)
member.summary: Called to handle an equation that exceeds the max. allowed length.
member.param: A List containining the values to be matched.
A string containing the current equation.

returns.para: 0, if the method created temp. columns and a new equation that does not exceed the max. allowed length.
1, if the current equation does not exceed the max. allowed length.
The length of the current equation if the method could not generate an alternative equation using temp. columns.

member.remarks:
The method sorts values as part of creating temp columns.
If the method succeeds, it updates the properties Equation and, in case temp. columns were created, TempColumnNames.
member.exception: If values or currentEquation is null.
If currentEquation is empty.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.AddTempColumns(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.DateTime},Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.AuditTest.FieldManagement,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary: Creates temp columns with equations that do not exceed IDEA's max equation length.
member.param:
The list of values to process.
If the list is empty, the method does nothing.
A FieldManagement object to which the method adds the computed columns. The method does not call PerformTask on fieldManager.
A string list to which the method adds the names of the temp. columns it created.
member.exception: If values, fieldManager or tempColumnNames is null.

0 in case temporary helper columns were added to the database. The names of the helper columns are available in the array TempColumnNames and the filter expression based on these columns in Equation.
member.exception: If listReader is null.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.HandleStringRangeList(Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.Parameters.IContentOfFromToListReader)
member.summary: Handles the case of a list of Time range values.
member.param: An IContentOfFromToListReader reference to the list of values. An exception is thrown if this reference is null or if its type is not Date.
member.returns:
An Int32 value. One of the following values will be returned:
1, if the length of the equation is less than the maximum allowed length. The method sets Equation to the all-rows filter, if GetMatchingRecords is true, or to the no-row filter, if GetMatchingRecords is false.
The length of the equation in case the equation exceeds the maximum allowed length and Database was not set or an equivalent equation could not be generated.
0, in case temporary helper columns were added to the database. The names of the helper columns are available in the array TempColumnNames and the filter expression based on these columns in Equation.
member.exception: If listReader is null.
If listReader.IsDate is false.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ColumnFilterBuilder.HandleLongStringRangeList(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Tuple{System.String,System.String}},System.String)
member.summary: Called to handle an equation that exceeds the max. allowed length.
member.param: A List containining the values to be matched. The method is allowed to sort the list.
A string containing the current equation.

returns.para: 0, if the method created temp. columns and a new equation that does not exceed the max. allowed length.
1, if the current equation does not exceed the max. allowed length.
The length of the current equation if the method could not generate an alternative equation using temp. columns.

member.remarks:
The method sorts values as part of creating temp columns.
If the method succeeds, it updates the properties Equation and, in case temp. columns were created, TempColumnNames.
member.exception: If values or currentEquation is null.
If currentEquation is empty.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.GeneralCommands.SimpleCommands.DateAdd(System.String,System.Int32,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Adds a number of intervals of a given size to a date/time value.
member.param:
A string that specifies the interval to add.
The list of valid values:
yyyy Year
q Quarter
m Month
y Day of year - same as d
d Day
w Weekday - same as d
ww Week
h Hour
n Minute
s Second
An Int32 that specifies the number of intervals to add. It can be positive or negative.
A DateTime value to which the method adds the interval.
member.exception: If interval is null.
If interval is not valid.
If the calculated date is before 00:00:00 on January 1 of the year 1, or later than 23:59:59 on December 31, 9999.
member.remarks: See also: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa227550(v=vs.60).aspx

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.GeneralCommands.SimpleCommands.GetMaxLength(System.Object,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the maximum of a field's max length and a specified min length value.
member.param:
Database name including path if needed. The file extension is not necessary. Alternatively the current database object (IIdeaDatabase or IComDatabase) can be provided.
For time or numeric fields of non-fixed length, the method uses field statistics; therefore, the field statistics of the specified field must either be already computed or the database reference must allow their computation.
A string containing the name of the field whose max length is requested.
An Int32 that specifies the min value of the result.
member.returns: An Int32 value that is the maximum of minLength and the specified field's max length.
member.exception: If database or fieldName is null.
If database is empty.
If the specified field was not found.
member.remarks:
The max length of a field is computed as follows:
If the database is empty or if all values of the field are in error, the max length of the field is zero.
If the field is alphanumeric, the max length is the length of the longest value with trailing spaces removed.
If the field type is Date, max length is 8.
If the field type is Boolean, max length is 1.
If the field type is Time, max length is the length of the latest time formatted using IDEA's time format.
If the field type is Numeric, max length is the length of the longest string representation using the following format: [-]dddd[.ddddd], where the dot appears only if the field's decimal count is not zero and the number of fractional decimal digits is equal to the field's declared number of decimals.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.GeneralCommands.SimpleCommands.GetMaxLength(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the maximum of a field's max length and a specified min length value.
member.param:
Database name including path if needed. The file extension is not necessary.
For time or numeric fields of non-fixed length, the method uses field statistics; therefore, the field statistics of the specified field must either be already computed or the database reference must allow their computation.
A string containing the name of the field whose max length is requested.
An Int32 that specifies the min value of the result.
member.returns: An Int32 value that is the maximum of minLength and the specified field's max length.
member.exception: If database or fieldName is null.
If database is empty.
If the specified field was not found.
member.remarks:
The max length of a field is computed as follows:
If the database is empty or if all values of the field are in error, the max length of the field is zero.
If the field is alphanumeric, the max length is the length of the longest value with trailing spaces removed.
If the field type is Date, max length is 8.
If the field type is Boolean, max length is 1.
If the field type is Time, max length is the length of the latest time formatted using IDEA's time format.
If the field type is Numeric, max length is the length of the longest string representation using the following format: [-]dddd[.ddddd], where the dot appears only if the field's decimal count is not zero and the number of fractional decimal digits is equal to the field's declared number of decimals.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.GeneralCommands.SimpleCommands.GetMaxLength(System.String,Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.IdeaAccess.Types.ExecutionLocation,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the maximum of a field's max length and a specified min length value.
member.param:
Database name including path if needed. The file extension is not necessary.
For time or numeric fields of non-fixed length, the method uses field statistics; therefore, the field statistics of the specified field must either be already computed or the database reference must allow their computation.
An ExecutionLocation value that specifies whether the database is located on the client or on the server.
A string containing the name of the field whose max length is requested.
An optional Int32 that specifies the min value of the result. Default value: 0.
member.returns: An Int32 value that is the maximum of minLength and the specified field's max length.
member.exception: If database or fieldName is null.
If database is empty.
If the specified field was not found.
member.remarks:
The max length of a field is computed as follows:
If the database is empty or if all values of the field are in error, the max length of the field is zero.
If the field is alphanumeric, the max length is the length of the longest value with trailing spaces removed.
If the field type is Date, max length is 8.
If the field type is Boolean, max length is 1.
If the field type is Time, max length is the length of the latest time formatted using IDEA's time format.
If the field type is Numeric, max length is the length of the longest string representation using the following format: [-]dddd[.ddddd], where the dot appears only if the field's decimal count is not zero and the number of fractional decimal digits is equal to the field's declared number of decimals.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.GeneralCommands.SimpleCommands.GetMaxLength(COMMONIDEACONTROLSLib.IIdeaDatabase,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the maximum of a field's max length and a specified min length value.
member.param:
An IIdeaDatabase reference to the database that contains the field whose max length is requested.
For time or numeric fields of non-fixed length, the method uses field statistics; therefore, the field statistics of the specified field must either be already computed or the database reference must allow their computation.
A string containing the name of the field whose max length is requested.
An optional Int32 that specifies the min value of the result. Default value: 0.
member.returns: An Int32 value that is the maximum of minLength and the specified field's max length.
member.exception: If database or fieldName is null.
If the specified field was not found.
member.remarks:

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.GeneralCommands.SimpleCommands.GetMinOrMaxValue(COMDBLib.IFieldStats,COMDBLib.IField,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the min / max value of the specified field from a field stats provider.
member.param: A COMDBLib.IFieldStats reference to an object that contains statistical data for the specified field. The method assumes that the statistical data was already computed.
A COMDBLib.IField reference to an object that contains metadata for the field.
A Boolean that specifies whether the method returns the min or max value. If true, the method returns the min value; otherwise, the max value. Default value: false
member.returns: An object. The method returns a 'zero' value if all the values of the fields are in error. For a date field, the method returns null if its min/max value is the null IDEA date. For a time field the method returns a double containing the time in seconds.
member.exception: If valueProvider or field is null.
If the field's type is not in {Numeric, Time, Date}.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.GeneralCommands.SimpleCommands.GetMaxLength(COMDBLib.IFieldStats,COMDBLib.IField)
member.summary: Calculates the max length of the specified field using a field stats provider.
member.param: A COMDBLib.IFieldStats reference to an object that contains statistical data for the specified field. The method assumes that the statistical data was already computed.
A COMDBLib.IField reference to an object that contains metadata for the field.
member.returns: An int. The method returns a 'zero' value if all the values of the fields are in error or if the database is empty.
member.exception: If valueProvider or field is null.
If the field's type is not in {Numeric, Time, Date, Boolean}.
member.remarks:
The max length of the field is computed as follows:
If all values of the field are in error, the max length of the field is zero.
If the field type is Date, max length is 8.
If the field type is Boolean, max length is 1.
If the field type is Time, max length is the length of the latest time formatted using IDEA's time format.
If the field type is Numeric, max length is the length of the longest string representation using the following format: [-]dddd[.ddddd], where the dot appears only if the field's decimal count is not zero and the number of fractional decimal digits is equal to the field's declared number of decimals.
Other field types are not supported.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.IdeaEquationBuilderHelper.GetMatchCallForStringColumnAndNontrivialRanges(System.Boolean,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Tuple{System.String,System.String}},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a call to an IDEA matching function for the specified column name and values.
member.param: A Boolean that specifies whether the equation selects the records that match the values (if true) or the records that do not match the values (if false).
The name of the column to be evaluated. The method assumes that the column is of type String.

A non-null and non-empty sequence of String range values that will be matched against the column.
The method uses GetBetweenStringCall to generate the expression for a range value.

A Boolean that specifies whether the match is case insensitive or not. If true, a case insensitive match is requested; otherwise, a case sensitive match.
Default value: false.
member.returns: A string containing the IDEA filter expression surrounded by parentheses if it consists of multiple terms.
member.exception: If columName or values is null.
If values is empty.
member.remarks: The method will not include white spaces that are not syntactically required.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.IdeaEquationBuilderHelper.GetBetweenStringCall(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an IDEA filter expression that tests whether a string column is in a given string range.
member.param: A Boolean that specifies whether the equation selects the records that match the values (if true) or the records that do not match the values (if false).
A Boolean that specifies whether the comparison is case insensitive (if true) or not (if false).
The name of the column to be evaluated.
A non-null from-value.
A non-null to-value.
member.exception: If columnName, from or to is null.
member.remarks:
The method will not include white spaces that are not syntactically required.
If ignoreCase is true, the method uses IDEA's @CompareNoCase to compare the column against a value unless the value does not change by converting it to lower, in which case the standard operator will be used.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.IdeaEquationBuilderHelper.GetMatchCallForSearchStringColumn(System.Boolean,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs an IDEA filter expression for the specified column of type String and search values.
member.param: A Boolean that specifies whether the equation selects the records that match the values (if true) or the records that do not match the values (if false).
The name of the column to be evaluated. The method assumes that the column is of type String.

A non-null and non-empty sequence of String values that will be matched against the column.
SA search patterns can use the wildcards * and ?. If a wildcard should be interpreted literally, the caller must escape it using the escape sequence \<wildcard>. The symbol \ must also be escaped using \\. The symbol \ escapes the character that follows it in the string.

A Boolean that specifies whether the match is case insensitive or not. If true, a case insensitive match is requested; otherwise, a case sensitive match.
Values that contain do not contain non-escaped wildcards will be matched against the column using the function @Match/@NoMatch. For the other values, @RegExpr will be used.
member.returns: A string containing the IDEA equation.
member.exception: If columnName or values is null.
If values is empty.
member.remarks: The method will not include white spaces that are not syntactically required.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.IdeaEquationBuilderHelper.MakeIdeaStringLiteral(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an IDEA expression that can represent a string constant.
member.param: The value for which an IDEA expression is created. An exception is thrown if this reference is null.
member.returns: A string containining an IDEA expression that escapes the special chars of the given literal.
member.exception: If value is null.
member.remarks: The method will not include white spaces that are not syntactically required.
member.example: If the input is ab"cd, the method returns "ab" + @Chr(34) + "cd". If the input is abc, the method returns "abc".

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.IdeaEquationBuilderHelper.ToIdeaRegExprPattern(System.String)
member.summary: Converts an SA search pattern (i.e., a string containing the wildcards * and ?) to an IDEA @RegExpr-pattern.
member.param: A string containing an SA search pattern. SA search patterns can use the wildcards * and ?. If a wildcard should be interpreted literally, the caller must escape it using the escape sequence \<wildcard>. The symbol \ must also be escaped using \\. The symbol \ escapes the character that follows it in the string.
member.returns: A string containing the @RegExpr-equivalent of the specified SA pattern.
member.exception: If value is null.
If value cannot be converted to a @RegExpr pattern (i.e., the last \ was not escaped properly).

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.IdeaEquationBuilderHelper.IsIdeaRegExprMetacharacter(System.Char)
member.summary: Determines whether a character is an IDEA @RegExpr metacharacter.
member.param: The character to test.
member.returns: True, if ch is a metacharacter; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.IdeaEquationBuilderHelper.TryToReduceSAPatternToLiterals(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to 'reduce' an SA search pattern to a string containing only literals.
member.param: A string containing an SA search pattern. SA search patterns can use the wildcards * and ?. If a wildcard should be interpreted literally, the caller must escape it using the escape sequence \<wildcard>. The symbol \ must also be escaped using \\. The symbol \ escapes the character that follows it in the string.
A string that receives the 'reduced' pattern if the method succeeds.
member.returns: True, if value does not contain any unescaped * or ?; otherwise, false.
member.exception: If the last \ was not escaped properly.
member.remarks: If value does not contain any of the chars '\', '*' or '.', the method sets result to value and returns true.

member.summary: Determines whether a character is an SA search pattern metacharacter.

member.summary: Gets the start and end dates of a week of year.

member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.Internal.IdeaDbCreatorOptions.GenerateUniqueTableName
member.summary: If set, the generator tries to create a unique database name starting from the suggested name.

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.Internal.IdeaDbCreatorOptions.OverwriteExistingDatabase
member.summary: If set and the database already exists, the generator overwrites it.
Creates a new IDEA database and optionally appends data to it.
member.param: An IExecutionContext reference to the execution context. An exception is thrown if this reference is null.

The name of the database. An exception is thrown if databaseName is null or empty. If options includes GenerateUniqueDatabaseName, the method tries to create a unique database name starting from databaseName.
An IdeaColumnMetadata array containing the meta data of the new table's columns. An exception is throw if this array is null or empty.
An optional function that adds rows to the database. This reference can be null.
An IdeaTableCreatorOptions value that specifies whether the method creates a unique table name or not.
member.exception: If context is null.
If databaseName is null.
If databaseName is empty or if it consists only of white spaces.
If columnsData is null.
If columnsData is empty.
If the database already exists and the option OverwriteExistingDatabase was not set.

member.summary: Deletes a database ignoring any non-critical exceptions.
member.param: The context. An exception is thrown if this reference is null.
The name of the database to delete. An exception is thrown if this reference is null. If the name is empty, the method does nothing.
member.returns: True, if the operation succeeded; otherwise false.
member.exception: If context is null.
If databaseName is null.

member.summary: Implements a calendar week calculator that uses the ISO-8601 rules.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.Internal.Iso8601CalendarWeekCalculator.GetWeekOfYear(System.DateTime,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Determines the week of year that includes the specified date.
member.param: The Gregorian calendar date and time value.
A reference to an int that receives the Gregorian calendar year of the value's week number.
member.returns: A positive int that contains the Gregorian calendar week of year that includes the specified date.
member.exception: If date is not in the valid range of the calendar used by the calculator.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.Internal.Iso8601CalendarWeekCalculator.GetWeekOfYearStartAndEnd(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Gets the start and end dates of a week of year.
member.param: An int representing the Gregorian calendar week of year.
An int representing the Gregorian calendar year.
The method ignores this value.
A reference to a DateTime value that receives the end date of the specified week of year.
member.returns: A DateTime? value or null, if the start date would be less than the calendar's min date.
member.exception: If week is less than 1 or year is less than the calendar's min year and week is not equal to the week of the calendar's min date or if week is greater than the number of weeks in the specified year.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ScriptCommands.NewSpecialDayFilter(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructs a new special day filter from the specified data or data provider object.
member.param:
An object that specifies the data or data provider object for the filter object.
Accepted types:
1) IContentOfListReader with the list element of type Date.
2) IEnumerable<DateTime>.
3) IEnumerable for a collection of boxed DateTime values.
4) IEnumerable for a collection whose elements are of type a) DateTime, b) object array of min length two, having at index 0 the IDEA string rep. (format yyyyMMdd) of a valid Gregorian calendar date and at index 1 the name of the special day, c) String containing the IDEA string rep. of a valid Gregorian calendar date or d) SpecialDayData.
5) IEnumerable<SpecialDayData>.
member.returns: An ISpecialDayFilter reference to the filter object.
member.exception: If values is null.
If values is of an unsupported type or if it contains items of an unknown format or nulls.
member.remarks: If values is an empty collection of a supported type, the method returns an empty filter.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ScriptCommands.EnumerateStandardSADateDayNamePairArray(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Converts an object array to an equivalent sequence of SpecialDayData items.
member.param:
The sequence to convert.
Accepted element types: 1) DateTime. 2) Object array of min length two, having at index 0 the IDEA string rep. (format yyyyMMdd) of a valid Gregorian calendar date and at index 1 the name of the special day. 3) String containing the IDEA string rep. of a valid Gregorian calendar date. 4) SpecialDayData.
member.remarks: If the array is empty, an empty sequence will be returned.
member.exception: If values is null.
If values contains items of an unknown format or nulls.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.ScriptCommands.TryConvertSpecialDayData(System.Object)
member.summary: Tries to convert an object to a SpecialDayData.
member.param:
The object to convert.
Accepted types: 1) DateTime. 2) Object array of min length two, having at index 0 the IDEA string rep. (format yyyyMMdd) of a valid Gregorian calendar date and at index 1 the name of the special day. 3) String containing the IDEA string rep. of a valid Gregorian calendar date. 4) SpecialDayData.
member.returns: A SpecialDayData instance, if the conversion succeeded; otherwise, null.

member.name: T:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.Types.ColognePhoneticsUtil.CodeAppender
member.summary: Appends CPH-codes to a StringBuilder according to the rules of the Cologne Phonetics algorithm: a) 0 is ignored unless it this the first code to be added. b) All other codes are added only if they are not equal to the last added code.

member.summary: Initializes a new appender with the specified builder.

member.exception: If builder is null.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.Types.ColognePhoneticsUtil.CodeAppender.Append(System.Char)
member.summary: Appends the specifies CPH-code (0, 1, 2, ..., 8) to the StringBuilder according to the rules of the Cologne Phonetics algorithm: a) 0 is ignored unless it this the first code to be added. b) All other codes are added only if they are not equal to the last added code.
member.param: The code to be added. Must be a digit in [0, 8].

member.summary: Implements the Cologne Phonetics algorithm according to https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/K%C3%B6lner_Phonetik.
member.param: A string containing the value to convert or null.
member.returns: A string containing the result of the conversion or null if value is null.

member.name: T:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.VatRegNoChecker
member.summary: Implements a task that checks the wellformedness of EU VAT registration numbers.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.VatRegNoChecker.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new empty VatRegNoChecker.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.VatRegNoChecker.Value
member.summary: Gets / sets a string containing the value to be checked.
member.remarks: The default value is null.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.VatRegNoChecker.CountryCode
member.summary: Gets the language-independent country code of Value.
member.returns: A string containing the language-independent country code of Value or null, if the country code is not available.
member.remarks: The default value is null. Call the method Perform before getting the actual value of the property.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.VatRegNoChecker.Country
member.summary: Gets the language-dependent country name of Value.
member.returns: A string containing the language-dependent country name of Value or null, if the country name is not available.
member.remarks: The default value is null. Call the method Perform before getting the actual value of the property.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.VatRegNoChecker.StructureValidity
member.summary: Gets a boolean that specified whether the structure of Value is valid.
member.returns: True, if Value's structure is valid; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The default value is false. Call the method Perform before getting the actual value of the property.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.VatRegNoChecker.RuleValidity
member.summary: Gets a VatConstructionRulesValidationResult value that specifies whether Value fulfills the VAT construction rules of its country.
member.returns: RulesFulfilled, if Value fulfills all construction rules, RulesNotFulfilled, if Value does not fulfill the construction rules or RulesNotAvailable, if the construction rules of Value's country are not available.
member.remarks: The default value is RulesNotFulfilled. Call the method Perform before getting the actual value of the property.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.MacroCommands.VatRegNoChecker.PerformTask
member.summary: Executes the task and stores the results in CountryCode, Country, StructureValidity and RuleValidity.
member.remarks: The method resets CountryCode, Country, StructureValidity and RuleValidity to their default state before performing the check.

member.name: T:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.CirDataPreparationLauncher
member.summary: The class CirDataPreparationLauncher is used by a CIR data preparation helper macro to launch the actual CIR data preparation from within an IDEA Server execution context. An instance of this class is passed on to the server as a parameter for the CIR data preparation helper routine and made available to the macro through SmartContext.Parameters. The CIR data preparation helper macro extracts this parameter from Smart

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.CirDataPreparationLauncher.Execute(System.Object)
member.summary: Executes the data preparation in the specified context.
member.param: The object that specifies the data preparation to execute. An exception is thrown if this reference is null or it it is not a TaskExecutionContext. An exception is thrown also if the current task is not running on an IDEA Server (that is, the value of the property IsServerTask is false).
member.exception: If context is null.
If context is not a TaskExecutionContext.
If the current task is not running on an IDEA Server.

In case the caller does not supply a non-null value for this property, the getter creates a Hashtable that uses the following comparer: StringComparer.OrdinalIgnoreCase. The dictionary must be accessible from within IDEA's ScriptEngine. Default: null. Init: On demand (see ContextUserData).
