member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ImportedDatabaseDataObject.SupportsMovingDatabaseToFolder
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the current execution context allows moving the database to another folder.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ImportedDatabaseDataObject.MoveDatabaseToFolder(Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ICirExecutionContext,System.String)
member.summary: Moves the database to the specified folder of the current project including the bad-data file that was generated during the import if available.
member.param:
A ICirExecutionContext reference to the current execution context. An exception is thrown if this reference is null.
An exception is thrown if the current execution context does not support moving the database, that is if SupportsMovingDatabaseToFolder is false.
Currently only IPartialImportContext supports this operation.

The name of the destination folder relative to the current project. The destination must be a subfolder of the current project. If the source and destination are the same, the method does nothing. If a database with the same name already exists in the destination folder, the method tries to move the database to the specified folder using a new name. The method does not overwrite databases in the destination folder.
An exception is thrown if this name is null or if it is not a relative path. An exception is thrown if the destination folder does not exist.
member.exception: If context is null.
If folder is null.
If the path to the folder is absolute.
If the current execution context does not support moving the database.
If the destination project subfolder already contained a database with the same name and the method could not move the database after retrying the operation a predefined number of times.
If the ImportedFileName is not null or empty and the file does not exist.
If the destination folder does not exist.
member.remarks: If the current object's ImportedFileName is null or empty, the method does nothing. If the database is moved, the method updates ImportedFileName to reflect the changes.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ImportedDatabaseDataObject.CheckTargetFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Validates the target folder argument.
member.param: The target folder.
member.returns: The trimmed target folder if valid.
member.exception: If folder is not valid.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ImportedDatabaseDataObject.MoveDatabaseToFolder(Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ICirExecutionContext,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Guid},System.String)
member.summary: Moves a database to a folder and returns the new fully-qualified name of the database.
member.param:
A ICirExecutionContext reference to the current execution context. An exception is thrown if this reference is null.
An exception is thrown if the current execution context does not support moving the database, that is if SupportsMovingDatabaseToFolder is false.
Currently only IPartialImportContext supports this operation.
The database to move. If null or empty, the method does nothing.
The id of the imported file or null if not available. The method uses it only when throwing an exception.

The name of the destination folder relative to the current project. The destination must be a subfolder of the current project. If the source and destination are the same, the method does nothing. If a database with the same name already exists in the destination folder, the method tries to move the database to the specified folder using a new name. The method does not overwrite databases in the destination folder.
An exception is thrown if this name is null or if it is not a relative path. An exception is thrown if the destination folder does not exist.
member.returns: The new fully-qualified name of the database or the initial importedFileName if null or empty.
member.exception: If context is null.
If folder is null.
If the path to the folder is absolute.
If the current execution context does not support moving the database.
If the destination project subfolder already contained a database with the same name and the method could not move the database after retrying the operation a predefined number of times.
If the ImportedFileName is not null or empty and the file does not exist.
If the destination folder does not exist.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.MoveImportedFilesToFolderTask.Add(Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ISimpleImportFile2,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a move operation to the task.
member.param: An ISimpleImportFile2 reference to the imported database to be moved. An exception is thrown if this reference is null. An exception is thrown if the import file does not support moving to another folder (that is, import.SupportsMovingDatabaseToFolder is false).

The name of the destination folder relative to the current project. The destination must be a subfolder of the current project. If the source and destination are the same, the move operation does nothing. If a database with the same name already exists in the destination folder, the operation tries to move the database to the specified folder using a new name. The method does not overwrite databases in the destination folder.
An exception is thrown if this name is null or if it is not a relative path. An exception is thrown if the destination folder does not exist.
member.exception: If importFile is null.
If the specified import file does not support moving the database.
If folder is null.
If the path to the folder is absolute.
If the destination folder does not exist.

member.name: P:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.SimpleImportFile.SupportsMovingDatabaseToFolder
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the current execution context allows moving the database to another folder.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.SimpleImportFile.MoveDatabaseToFolder(Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Interfaces.CustomImportRoutines.Runtime.ICirExecutionContext,System.String)
member.summary: Moves the database to the specified folder of the current project.
member.param:
A ICirExecutionContext reference to the current execution context. An exception is thrown if this reference is null.
An exception is thrown if the current execution context does not support moving the database, that is if SupportsMovingDatabaseToFolder is false.
Currently only IPartialImportContext supports this operation.

The name of the destination folder relative to the current project. The destination must be a subfolder of the current project. If the source and destination are the same, the method does nothing. If a database with the same name already exists in the destination folder, the method tries to move the database to the specified folder using a new name. The method does not overwrite databases in the destination folder.
An exception is thrown if this name is null or if it is not a relative path. An exception is thrown if the destination folder does not exist.
member.exception: If context is null.
If folder is null.
If the path to the folder is absolute.
If the current execution context does not support moving the database.
If the destination project subfolder already contained a database with the same name and the method could not move the database after retrying the operation a predefined number of times.
If the ImportedFileName is not null or empty and the file does not exist.
If the destination folder does not exist.
member.remarks: If the current object's ImportedFileName is null or empty, the method does nothing. If the database is moved, the method updates ImportedFileName to reflect the changes.

An exception is thrown if this reference is null.

member.name: T:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2
member.summary: This enum mirrors IDEA's IdeaServer.Core.Entities.Interfaces.TaskState enum. There are following reasons for using our own TaskState2 enum: 1. IDEA's enum is defined in insigned module which cannot be referenced by all SA modules 2. Our enum extends that of IDEA defining some additional states internally used by SA

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2.Queued
member.summary: Ready for execution (1)

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2.Scheduled
member.summary: Submitted to the Windows Scheduler (2)

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2.SelectedForExecution
member.summary: Task has successfully been de-serialized and is ready to run (3)

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2.Starting
member.summary: Task is opening the IMD files and/or other input data (4)

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2.Running
member.summary: Task is responding with progress callbacks (5)

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2.Completed
member.summary: Tasks has completed succesfully (7)

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2.RetryExecutionLater
member.summary: An IMD file is locked by another process, task will try again once the queue is flushed of other tasks (8)

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2.UserCancelled
member.summary: Client application has returned E_USER_CANCELLED from a progress call (9)

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2.AbortFailed
member.summary: SA internal: task object is about to be created and initialized

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2.Initializing
member.summary: SA internal: attempt to abort the task has failed

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2.Planned
member.summary: SA internal: task is planned for execution

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2.Reconnected
member.summary: SA internal: running task was just reconnected to

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TaskState2.RequestStateNeeded
member.summary: SA internal: task requires requesting of its state from server

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.IntellectualPropertyOptions.IgnoreIPProtectionByTempFiles
member.summary: If set, this flag instructs not to take IP protection level into account when dealing with temp files (instead, flags like DeleteTempFiles have to be considered). For instance, the flag has to be set in case deleting the temp files is controlled NOT by IP protection but by some external means (like UI elements etc.)

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.IntellectualPropertyOptions.DeleteTempFiles
member.summary: When the flag IgnoreIPProtectionByTempFiles is set, deleting the temporary files created by ATs and CIRs is controlled by this flag: files get deleted in case the flag is set, files get kept in case the flag is not set

member.summary: No options

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TestTableAssociateOptions.PartialTaggingForPrimaryIsAllowed
member.summary: When set, primary input file can be associated to IDEA table when partially tagged. By default, full tagging is required for primary input file

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TestTableAssociateOptions.FullTaggingForSecondaryIsRequired
member.summary: When set, secondary input file can be associated to IDEA table only hwen fully tagged. By default, partial tagging is sufficient for secondary input file

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TestTableAssociateOptions.TagBasedAssociationOnly
member.summary: When set, associate methods will ignore logical input file having direct associate type (TagType==None).

member.name: F:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Types.TestTableAssociateOptions.DirectAssociationOnly
member.summary: When set, associate methods will ignore logical input file having tag-based associate type (TagType==Full or TagType==Optional).

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.CalendarHelper.GetIso8601WeekOfYear(System.DateTime,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns an ISO8601 week number (assumptions: Weeks start on Monday and the week 1 is the week with the year's first Thursday in it
member.param: A DateTime value whose week number is requested.
An int that receives the year of the value's week number.
member.remarks: Based on Wikipedia's algorithm at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_week_date.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.CalendarHelper.GetIso8601WeekOfYearAsString(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the ISO-8601 WeekOfYear formatted as yyyy-Www.
member.param: A DateTime value whose week number is requested.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.CalendarHelper.GetIso8601WeeksPerYear(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the number of weeks in the specified year.
member.param: An int representing the year whose week count is requested.
member.returns: An int containing the week count.
member.remarks: Based on "The Mathematics of the ISO 8601 Calendar" (http://www.staff.science.uu.nl/~gent0113/calendar/isocalendar.htm).

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.CalendarHelper.GetIso8601WeeksPerYearFast(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the number of weeks in the specified year.
member.param: An int representing the year whose week count is requested.
member.returns: An int containing the week count.
member.remarks: Based on a rule derived in 2001 by Simon Cassidy and presented in "The Mathematics of the ISO 8601 Calendar" (http://www.staff.science.uu.nl/~gent0113/calendar/isocalendar.htm).

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.CalendarHelper.p(System.Int32)
member.summary: P-function for GetIso8601WeeksPerYearFast.
member.param: An int representing the year.
member.remarks: Based on a rule derived in 2001 by Simon Cassidy and presented in "The Mathematics of the ISO 8601 Calendar" (http://www.staff.science.uu.nl/~gent0113/calendar/isocalendar.htm).

An int representing the year.

A Calendar object.
A CalendarWeekRule value.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.CalendarHelper.GetWeekOfYearStartAndEnd(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Globalization.Calendar,System.Globalization.CalendarWeekRule,System.DayOfWeek,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Gets the start and end dates of a week of year number, using the specified calendar, calendar week rule and first day of week.
member.param: An int representing the week number.
An int representing the calendar-specific year.
An non-zero int representing the era of the calendar year or zero, if the calendar year is in the current calendar's era.
A Calendar object.
A CalendarWeekRule value.
A DayOfWeek value that specifies the first day of the week.
A reference to a DateTime value that receives the end date of the specified week.
member.returns: A DateTime? value or null, if the start date would be less than the calendar's min date.
member.exception: If week is less than 1 or year is less than the calendar's min year and week is not equal to the week of the calendar's min date or if week is greater than the number of weeks in the specified year.
If calendar is null.

If calendar or eraInfo is null.

member.name: T:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.CancellableQueue`1
member.summary:
Simple FIFO queue class. On enqueue, a new thread from thread pool is started that dequeues items and calls a callback method passed to the queue as construction parameter. The number of such thread is limited through construction parameter.
The buffer handles aborting of working threads properly.

member.name: T:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.RijndaelSimple
member.summary: This class uses a symmetric key algorithm (Rijndael/AES) to encrypt and decrypt data. As long as encryption and decryption routines use the same parameters to generate the keys, the keys are guaranteed to be the same. The class uses static functions with duplicate code to make it easier to demonstrate encryption and decryption logic. In a real-life application, this may not be the most efficient way of handling encryption, so - as soon as you feel comfortable with it - you may want to redesign this class.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.RijndaelSimple.Encrypt(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.RijndaelSimple.HashAlgorithmValues,System.Int32,System.String,Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.RijndaelSimple.KeySizeValues)
member.summary: Encrypts specified byte array using Rijndael symmetric key algorithm and returns a byte array result.
member.param: Plaindata value to be encrypted (as byte array)

Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that this passphrase is an ASCII string.
Salt value used along with passphrase to generate password. Salt can be any string. In this example we assume that salt is an ASCII string.
Hash algorithm used to generate password. Allowed values are: "MD5" and "SHA1". SHA1 hashes are a bit slower, but more secure than MD5 hashes.
Number of iterations used to generate password. One or two iterations should be enough.
Initialization vector. This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long.
Size of encryption key in bits. Allowed values are: 128, 192, and 256. Longer keys are more secure than shorter keys.
member.returns: Encrypted value formatted as a byte array.
member.exception: Thrown when any of the params is null (or empty for strings)
Thrown when hashAlgorithm is not MD5 or SHA1
Thrown when keySize is not 128, 192 or 256
Thrown when passwordIterations is smaller than 1
Thrown when initVector is not 16 chars long

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.RijndaelSimple.Decrypt(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.RijndaelSimple.HashAlgorithmValues,System.Int32,System.String,Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.RijndaelSimple.KeySizeValues)
member.summary: Decrypts specified ciphertext using Rijndael symmetric key algorithm.
member.param: Byte array formatted ciphertext value.

Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that this passphrase is an ASCII string.
Salt value used along with passphrase to generate password. Salt can be any string. In this example we assume that salt is an ASCII string.
Hash algorithm used to generate password. Allowed values are: "MD5" and "SHA1". SHA1 hashes are a bit slower, but more secure than MD5 hashes.
Number of iterations used to generate password. One or two iterations should be enough.
Initialization vector. This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long.
Size of encryption key in bits. Allowed values are: 128, 192, and 256. Longer keys are more secure than shorter keys.
member.remarks: Most of the logic in this function is similar to the Encrypt logic. In order for decryption to work, all parameters of this function - except cipherText value - must match the corresponding parameters of the Encrypt function which was called to generate the ciphertext.
member.exception: Thrown when any of the params is null (or empty for strings)
Thrown when hashAlgorithm is not MD5 or SHA1
Thrown when keySize is not 128, 192 or 256
Thrown when passwordIterations is smaller than 1
Thrown when initVector is not 16 chars long

member.name: T:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.FifoQueue`1
member.summary:
Simple FIFO queue class. On enqueue, a new thread from thread pool is started that dequeues items and calls a callback method passed to the queue as construction parameter. The number of such thread is limited through cunstruction parameter.
The dequeueing process can also be blocked by external wait handles passed in AssignBlockingQueues() method.

member.name: M:Audicon.SmartAnalyzer.Common.Utilities.Utilities.ComputeId(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Computes a deterministic GUID from a GUID and a language code following RFC 4122, section 4.3.
member.param: The language-independent id of an object.

The language code. The function uses the lower-case version (using the rules of the invariant culture) of the language code to compute the new identifier. An exception is thrown if this reference is null.
member.returns: A new version 5 GUID derived from the id and the lower-case version (using the rules of the invariant culture) of the language code.
member.exception: If languageCode is null.

remarks.para: The function has the following property: Two results are equal if and only if the language-independent ids are equal and the language codes are equal (except the casing).
The function generates a version 5 GUID according to RFC4122 for name-based UUIDs using the SHA1 hash algorithm.
The code follows Bradley Grainger's implementation of the GuidUtility class. Please refer to code.logos.com ("Generating a deterministic GUID") for details.
